alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 01 at 3:37AM CDT until September 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Friday and Saturday... .Confidence is rather high for red flag conditions to occur along a Stratton, Nebraska to Colby and Leoti, Kansas line today. Therefore have extended the warning area east. Confidence is increasing for prolonged critical fire weather conditions on Saturday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ TODAY TO 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR counties along and west of a Stratton, Nebraska to Colby and Leoti, Kansas line... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR Dundy and all counties in Northwest Kansas... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy. * WINDS...Today south winds 20-25 mph with gusts up to 35 MPH. For Saturday south winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that are started during the afternoon may quickly become out of control. In addition, any activities that generate sparks may easily start a fire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
